Text saved: During the 18th and 19th centuries two main theories about dreams became popular.  

The first theory says that the images we see in dreams represent hidden thoughts in our mind. It was supported by Freud, a psychologist who studied the mind and believed that understanding dreams can reveal hidden feelings and the problems they cause.  

The opposite theory, however, claimed that dreams are just a collection of random activity in the brain while it organizes memories and events from the day.  

When we wake up, we try to make sense of these random images and feelings by turning them into a simple story.
